events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of June 1st, causing significant damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster based on the customer's description of the car accident.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist with the evaluation and guide the customer through the claim process.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the vehicle accident report had been successfully recorded.
The agent requested further documentation including photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and proof of insurance coverage.
Customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed photographs and the official police report confirming the accident details.
The investigation team has begun assessing the damage to the vehicle and reviewing the submitted documents to ensure all information matches.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of the collision circumstances and an estimated repair cost provided by the approved mechanic.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the full cost of repairs minus the deductible as per policy terms.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of their auto accident claim.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was officially approved and the payment process was initiated to cover the vehicle repairs.
Payment was successfully issued to the approved repair shop account to cover all the approved costs associated with the accident.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation from the customer that the vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely according to company policy for future reference if needed.
